harmonizer 0.3
  • Reference

Insets target vector back to input object (data)

inset_vector_new.Rd

Insets target vector back to input object (data)

inset_vector_new(data, vector, ...)

Arguments

data

an object
vector

a vector to inset. Optional. Default is NULL
...

Arguments passed on to harmonize_options

col

Column of interest in the data object. The one we need to harmonize

rows

Logical vector to filter records of interest. Default is NULL which means do not filter records

ommitted_rows_values

If rows is set merge these values to the results. It should be a vector of length 1 or nrow(data). If the value is NULL (default) then use original values of col`

placement

Where to inset retults (harmonized vector) in the data object. Default options is "replace_col" which overwrides the col in data with results.

name

Use this name for the first column in results (harmonized names). Default is NULL, which means that either name_if_data_atomic if data is vector or original col name will be used with name_suffix at the end.

name_if_input_atomic

If data is vector use this name for original column if it is in results. Default is "data". If data is table the name of col will be used.

name_suffix

If name is not set the use this as suffix (default is "harmonized"). If the name with the same suffix already edataists in select_data_cols it will add counter at the end to avoid variables with the same names.

append_copy

Whether to append a copy of result vector to data object

append_copy_name_format

How the append copy wiil be named

select_cols

If data` object is table, set the columns to cbind to the result table. Default is cbind all but the original (unharmonized) column (col).

Value

returns updated data object
